alert.note: Alert for Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 11 at 12:14PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern New Jersey, including the following county, Somerset. * WHEN...Until 630 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1212 PM EST, the USGS river gauge at South Branch indicated high water as a result of the one to two inches of rain that has fallen. Water levels will remain elevated through the afternoon. - For North Branch Raritan River at South Branch: At 11:00am the stage was 9.0 feet. Flood Stage is 8 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
